What role does Cahir play in the Nilfgaa: Cahir, a native of Vicovaro, was an intelligence officer in the Nilfgaardian Empire. He played a significant role in the search for Princess Ciri, aligning with Geralts company for this mission.
Why did Yennefer save Cahir in the serie: In the series, Yennefer rescues Cahir Mawr Dyffryn aep Ceallach, believing his death to be pointless. She finds him in a cell following an encounter with Vilgefortz, assuring him he wont die at their hands. This act is a part of Yennefers personal journey, marked by her quest across the Continent and her battle with the loss of her magical abilities.
What is the significance of Cahir's titl: The Black Knight title of Cahir Mawr Dyffryn aep Ceallach in The Witcher denotes his status as a knight, a role earned through service to the monarch or country, often militarily. Cahir, originating from Vicovaro, is frequently engaged in combat, including the notable Assault on Stygga Castle where he fights with Ciri. His title also symbolizes his Nilfgaardian armors color.
Who are Cahir's siblings in the Witcher: Cahir Mawr Dyffryn aep Ceallach, a character from the Witcher series, has an unspecified number of brothers. Their identities are not detailed in the series.
